info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington, northern Rensselaer, northwestern Bennington and northwestern Windham Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Hoosick Falls, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hoosick Falls around 235 PM EDT. Cambridge around 240 PM EDT. Shaftsbury around 245 PM EDT. Arlington around 250 PM EDT. Manchester around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Schaghticoke Hill, Center White Creek, Hoosick Junction, Sodom, Beartown, Chiselville, Center Falls, Johnsonville, East Hebron and Schaghticoke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York...and southern Vermont.
